reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great place to stay away from the crowded streets. The room was very small, we were quite shocked when we saw it. We had arrived from Florence and there we had a beautiful, massive room overlooking a piazza, so we were disappointed with the small room with view on to a wall. The receptionist even made a joke about the size of the room being "sufficiently small" as he counted our cash at checkout, which we felt was over stepping the mark.
reviews.title: Great location, shame about room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend paying a bit more and getting a larger room, although as nobody had written about this in the reviews, we simply looked at the photos and thought we would also be getting a good room. Or simply finding another hotel in the Jewish quarter, which is where this B&B is located, as it is a lovely quiet area of the city.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.text: Breakfast was ok, again had better in Florence and also the people who were in bigger rooms seemed to have the preference on sitting outside next to the canal.
reviews.title: A Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beds were small and didn't make for a good nights sleep. Overall I don't think it represented value for money, even in an expensive city.
reviews.title: The BEST little hotel in Venice!

reviews.text: This hotel was fantastic! Right from the start it was easy to get to from the train station and once there Daniele at the front desk immediately got out a map and showed us how to get around and located hot spots on the map for us. The area is so great because it is a little less touristy than near St. Mark's so the prices are better too but it is still an easy walk to all the major sights. One of our favorite meals in Venice was 2 blocks away on the same street at the Gam Gam. Awesome falafel and shawirma! We went back twice! Our room was beautiful and clean. Guests can go down to the breakfast room for breakfast or have it sent up to their room which we did and it was so great to eat breakfast in bed. Good food too. We would definately recommend this place and stay here again. The place was great and the staff were excellent!.
reviews.title: Beautiful little gem, we will go back again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located on one of the main canals, we were very impressed with the friendliness, service and cleanliness of the hotel. Every morning we ate breakfast on the canal, watching water taxi's and other boats go by. The rooms are decorated in 18th century style, so you won't forget staying there.
reviews.title: Great Find
Wonderful in all respects
reviews.text: We just returned from Italy and our last stop in Venice was the most special. Paolo the owner could not have been any more accommodating! He got us glasses and serving items so we could enjoy the 4th floor patio with drinks and snacks. Breakfast on the canal was picturesque and lovely. I'd recommend paying the extra for the upgraded room - we had one of each and the larger one was definitely worth the extra 20 euro a night! This hotel is by the Jewish quarter in a truly residential district. It's walking distance to the train station and easy to get to the hustle and bustle of Venice....but was truly Venice as we wanted it - quiet and peaceful. Truly a great experience. Would recommend to anyone.

I stayed at the Ca' Dogressa with 3 girls friends for a weekend at the beginning of May. We had two rooms converted into twins on the 1st floor - they were extremely comfortable, clean with great size shower rooms. Breakfast served by the very charming Paolo can be taken outside by the Canal if warm enough and luckily enough it was for us on the Sunday morning. Fabulous breakfast with warm brioche, juice, delicious coffee and we were able to eat the fruit we had bought in the market earlier - try the peaches as they were like nectar! As mentioned, Paolo is a great host and nothing is too much trouble and we were treated like royalty!! The hotel is in a fantastic, quiet area that is well worth exploring in it's own right and very close to the Jewish Ghetto but it is also only a 20 minute walk to St Marks square and very close to a number of vaparetto's. Burano is well worth a trip as it is so pretty but the best way to enjoy this beautiful city is to walk, walk and walk and wonder off down the quiet back streets and canals. The hotel can be easily reached by taking a number 5 bus from the Airport and walking from the Bus Station - you can also buy a joint bus and vaparetto pass for the number of days you are staying, which proved very cost effective. All in all I would thoroughly recommend this little jewel...
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed our short stay at Ca Dogaressa. One thing that was really convenient is that we were able to take a public waterbus from the airport, and the stop was really close to the hotel. The staff was really friendly and I appreciated how they let us choose to take breakfast outside! Cute bar nearby for a drink after a long day of touring.
reviews.title: Tucked away- nice place!

reviews.text: My daughter & I stayed at the hotel after reading about it on this site. It is a 5-7 minute walk from the train station and right on the Cannaregio Canal. Our room was pretty & comfortable and the breakfast was very good. We got in early & dropped our luggage off before our room was ready, and on the day of departure we left the luggage again so we could sight-see before our train. It was very convenient and allowed us to make the most of our time in Venice. The host was very friendly & helpful. I recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Charming hotel in good location

reviews.text: This hidden gem off of the main walkways to and from the canal was a quick 10 minute walk from the train station. Upon arrival, we were greeted by Gianpaolo, the owner, who showed us to our first room, which in and of itself was a beauty. As we were getting settled, he stopped in to offer us an upgrade to one of the suites on the second level, overlooking the canal. His reasoning was that we should not be distracted by the noise of the check-in desk and the eating area (which the room was sandwiched between) and hence, offered us a more spacious suite with larger bed, stand alone closet/bureau, a large sitting area with pull-out bed, and a luxurious bathroom with spa tub. He told us he would keep the same price as the other room - we had booked the night before on an online website and were only there for one night. The hotel is about a 5 minute walk from the main thoroughfare that connects you to the rest of the island. The only drawback I could say we had was that it is located opposite the majority of the attractions, hence a longer walk. For some this may not be an issue (it really wasn't for us). Gianpaolo's wife, Graziella, offered us a great suggestion for lunch, where we had one of the best meals in our 10-day excursion of Italy (and that included visiting other cities like Rome, Florence, and Bologna!) Their hospitality in the morning during breakfast and at check-out were beyond all expectations. Fresh squeezed orange juice, homemade croissants, offers for cappuccino or American Cafe, etc. all added to the feeling of welcome. Definitely a 5-star experience here!
reviews.title: An off-the-beaten-path mom and pop hotel with old world charm and new world conveniences

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided to stay at this hotel because all the good reviews. And it lived up to the reviews! Everyone that worked there were very pleasant and helpful, the only complaint is the restaurant they told us to go too.... The room was kind of small, but I'm from America and everything here is Big! I loved the fact that it was off the beaten path but too far from all the tourist attractions. I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: I'd stay again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nestled "out of the way" from other b&bs and hotels but only minutes walk from the main canal this hidden gem is a great value. Clean, and close to several water bus stations but also within walking distance of some attractions this b&b is quaint and a wonderful deal. The owner and his family are a delight and always eager to offer advice, help and treat you like family. The hotel is mere blocks from the old Jewish Quarter and the historic "ghetto." There are several excellent restaurants very close. We found it easy to walk to everywhere in the city but we took advantage of the water bus system too.
reviews.title: Bed and Breakfast is a hidden gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was beautifully decorated. it had some gorgeous Venetian glass chandeliers hung in it. But its the delightful owner who makes staying here so special. And there is nothing like sitting down by the canal, early morning, while enjoying a delicious breakfast.
reviews.title: Unbeatable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was an important trip for us and we were looking for something quaint, out of the way (but not too far away from the main tourist attractions), quiet and romantic and reasonably priced. we were very satisfied.
reviews.title: Great Stay in Venice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have stayed several times at the Ca'Dogaressa as guests of Paolo and his family. The location in Carnareggio is not central but is surrounded by fabulous restuarants and bars, more affordable than the better known areas. Breakfast on the canal, served and prepared by the owners is a treat and it's amazing to start the day watching the locals at work and play. Take the time to buy some local delicacies at the local markets and enjoy the evening sunset from the rooftop patio. Paolo provided us with wine glasses, plates and cutlery when we did this and nothing is a problem. Have recommended to others and will hopefully stay again.
reviews.title: Wonderfully local experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staying at this hotel/B&B was a delight from start to finish. Our host Paolo was very welcoming, and went out of his way to assist us. He even made us a coffee after the official breakfast time had finished, when we overslept one morning.
reviews.title: Fabulous and Friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was beautifully decorated, and very spacious. It was great to open the shutters on the windows in the mornings and see the boats out on the canal, and watch the locals greeting each other on their way to the markets or work.
reviews.title: What a gem! Highly recommended!

reviews.text: We would definitely stay at Ca' Dogaressa again.
reviews.title: wonderful family run small hotel

reviews.text: This was a slightly more expensive hotel than we had stayed in before, but it was so much nicer than anything we have seen before as well. The room was exquisite - beautifully detailed, modern clean bathroom. My wife flipped when she saw it,completely in awe - so it's clearly a good spot for a romantic gettaway!
reviews.title: This is a great place to stay in Venice
